roles.char: Pete Daley, Old Timer Killed by Baxter

title: Chinaman's Chance
description: An outlaw gang is stealing gold from Chinese placer miners, then driving off their claims with outrageous taxes. Because they're Chinese, they can't sue the local government agents. With Stoney posing as a Chinese miner and Pat pretending to be a representative of an Eastern engineering company, the U.S. government tries to bring an end to the careers of the outlaw gang and crooked state government agents.

title: The Golden Wolf
description: Pat and Stoney take time out from their duties to try and collect the bounty posted on a legendary golden wolf that roams the Colorado foothills. A couple of wolf hunters don't take kindly to a pair of amateur hunters horning in on their range and attempt to drive the G-Men away before they can capture or kill their quarry.

title: Chippewa Indians
description: Pat and Stoney are ordered to Wisconsin to investigate an Indian agent's claim that a lumber company is forcing the Chippewa Indians off their reservation in order to harvest pristine stands of pine trees. The G-men's investigation is hindered by the distrust of the Chippewas as well as the lumbermen.

title: Center Fire
description: Pat and Stoney are ordered to California to investigate reports of an anthrax epidemic and get involved in murder and a feud between neighboring ranchers.

title: Beware! No Trespassing
description: Pat and Stoney are ordered to San Pablo, Mexico, to find out what's behind the trouble an American tungsten mine is having. When they arrive, they discover the mine has been closed, the wells are all poisoned and the town is in the grip of a malaria epidemic. To make matters worse, the lawmen have been followed by four gunslingers determined to give the American troubleshooters all the trouble they can handle - and more.

title: Running Iron
description: The G-Men try to clear a cattle buyer for the government who is accused of buying stolen stock.

title: Hang the Jury
description: Pat and Stoney are sent to Oklahoma to assist the state authorities to investigate a hanging judge. Stoney's plan to go undercover backfires when he is framed for murder himself.

title: Silver Shotgun
description: Pat and Stoney track a killer who uses a shotgun on his victims to a town run with an iron hand by a sheriff who makes his own laws.

title: Rawhiders
description: Pat and Stoney are assigned to investigate reports of an impostor posing as a U.S. Secret Service agent operating in Washington territory. In the guise of a government law officer, the man is shutting down all rivals of a saloon keeper's operating a crooked gambling establishment.

title: Gypsy Traders
description: A band of gypsies settles down in the Montana Territory to take advantage of the copper stakes they've made in the region. In the nearby town of Bender, a group of shady locals believe the settlers should be stripped of their rights and take the matter to court. When it looks like the judge is going to rule for the gypsies, the outlaws kidnap him and lock him in the local jail.

title: Safe Crackers
description: Pat and Stoney are ordered to break up a safe cracking gang preying on Colorado banks handling government silver bullion.

roles.char: Jed Hawkins, Bull Frog Mine Owner
Pete Culp, Caretaker Lady Luck Mine

title: Sawdust Swindle
description: Stoney and the son of the local Indian chief are attacked while escorting a gold shipment meant for the tribe. The nuggets are stolen, the Indian killed and Stoney is arrested for the murder and theft. With his partner in jail, Pat endeavors to learn who is behind the robbery and the previous thefts of tools and supplies meant for the Indians before the tribe returns to the warpath to avenge the death of their kinsman.

title: The Woman Mayor
description: Pat and Stoney are ordered to Nugget City to tear down a toll-gate on federal land. They are opposed by a woman mayor who uses the gate to keep out riff-raff and raise money for growing town's needs.

roles.char: Mike Gaffney, Head Guard at Mt. Ophir
Capt. Walker of the River Queen
